bibl.title: Kichitaro Kubota and Ise Kubota v. Henry M. White. Stipulation
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: In the District Court of the United States Western District of Washington
Louis E. Sands Company, Inc. a corporation Plaintiff
Filed in the United States District Court
LEWIS E SANDS, INC. a corporation, Plaintiff,
JOSEPH TRAVERS & SONS LTD., a corporation

It is stipulated by and between Peters & Powell, attorneys for plaintiff, and Kerr, McCord & Ivey, attorneys for the defendant, that the above entitled action may be dismissed with prejudice,. and the attachment bond issued herein released and the surety discharged.
LOUIS E. SANDS COMPANY, INC., a corporation, Plaintiff,
JOS. TRAVERS & SONS, a corporation, Defendant,

IT IS STIPULATED on the part of the Seattle National Bank, as garnishee herein, that the attachment and garnishment proceedings herein may be dismissed with prejudice and without recovery of cost to any of the parties herein; and that so far as the Seattle National Bank is concerned, the attachment bond herein given and filed by the plaintiff as principal and the United States Fidelity & Guaranty Co. as surety, may be released and the surety thereon discharged.
